intro: Begonia erecta, commonly known as the upright begonia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. It features upright stems that can grow up to 1 meter in height, adorned with heart-shaped, glossy green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is often variegated with white or cream markings, adding ornamental value to gardens. Begonia erecta thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for shaded garden beds and containers.
